definition[0]: to prevent something from falling by putting something against it or under it
example[0]: The builders are trying to prop up the crumbling walls of the church.
example[1]: paintings propped up against the wall
definition[1]: to help an economy, industry, or government so that it can continue to exist, especially by giving money
example[2]: The government introduced measures to prop up the stock market.
definition[2]: to hold your body up by leaning against something
example[3]: She propped herself up on one elbow.
